title: Extreme Makeover at the Y
sub_head: The recently opened YMCA in the Bronx is a welcoming, modern achievement that, in both style and substance, points to the future of a historic organization.
body:
The Bronx, N.Y.
What building type is more conservative than the traditional YMCA? More than a thousand were built before World War I, providing young men with cheap lodging in a healthy moral environment. They were “Manhood Factories”—so Paula Lupkin’s study of the classic YMCA calls them—three- or four-story brick boxes, not quite hotels and not quite clubhouses, but somewhere in between.
